I'll continue to support my staff as they build their families, and I'll continue to support legislation to give every American family leave benefits. If we are serious about being pro-family in this country, I can't think of a better place to start.

Studies show that parental leave contributes to improved mental health and long-term development in children. And as a father of two myself, I wouldn't trade time I spend with my children for anything else - especially time spent together when they were young.

June is a busy time in Congress and there isn't a shortage of work to do, but there isn't anything that can't wait or can't be handled by other members of the team while he's home bonding with his newborn.
In fact, my Chief of Staff and his wife just welcomed their second daughter to the world earlier this month.

This isn't a talking point, this is something I take seriously in my office. Parenthood is celebrated and new parents are encouraged to take extended *paid* family leave time so they can be in the most important place when their child arrives - home.

On #FathersDay we celebrate the vital role dads play in the lives of their children. Being a parent is the most important job anyone could ever have, and we need to be doing all we can to support dads and moms as they raise their families.
